title: PHYLONOE
content:
PHYLONOE was a Spartan maiden who was granted immortality as a demigoddess in the train of Artemis. According
        to Athenagoras Phylonoe was worshipped in Sparta. Her name means "mind of the people" from the Greek
        words phylÃª and noos. She was perhaps identified with Polyboia.

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 126 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd
          A.D.) :
        "The daughters of Tyndareos (Tyndareus) and Leda were Timandra, whom Ekhemos (Echemus) married;
        Klytaimnestra (Clytemnestra), whom Agamemnon married; and Phylonoe, whom Artemis made immortal."

Other references not currently quoted here: Hesiod Frag 23a, Athenagoras Leg. Pro Christ. 1.

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
